   19: %%
   20: -module(big_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0]).
   24: 
   25: -export([t_div/1, eq_28/1, eq_32/1, eq_big/1, eq_math/1, eq_big_mul_div/1,
   26:          big_literals/1, borders/1, negative/1, karatsuba/1,
   27:          big_float_1/1, big_float_2/1,
   28:          bxor_2pow/1, band_2pow/1,
   29:          shift_limit_1/1, powmod/1, system_limit/1, toobig/1, otp_6692/1,
   30:          properties/1]).
   31: 
   32: %% Internal exports.
   33: -export([eval/1]).
   34: -export([init/3]).
   35: 
   36: -export([fac/1, fib/1, pow/2, gcd/2, lcm/2]).
   37: 
   38: 
   39: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   40: 
   41: suite() ->
   42:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   43:      {timetrap, {minutes, 3}}].
   44: 
   45: all() -> 
   46:     [t_div, eq_28, eq_32, eq_big, eq_math, eq_big_mul_div,
   47:      big_literals, borders, negative, karatsuba,
   48:      {group, big_float}, shift_limit_1,
   49:      bxor_2pow, band_2pow,
   50:      powmod, system_limit, toobig, otp_6692,
   51:      properties].
   52: 
   53: groups() -> 
   54:     [{big_float, [], [big_float_1, big_float_2]}].
   55: 
   56: %%
   57: %% Syntax of data files:
   58: %% Expr1 = Expr2.
   59: %% ...
   60: %% built in functions are:
   61: %% fac(N).
   62: %% fib(N).
   63: %% pow(X, N)  == X ^ N
   64: %% gcd(Q, R) 
   65: %% lcm(Q, R)
   66: %%
   67: eq_28(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   69:     test(TestFile).
   70: 
   71: eq_32(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   73:     test(TestFile).
   74: 
   75: eq_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   76:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   77:     test(TestFile).
   78: 
   79: eq_math(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   81:     test(TestFile).
   82: 
   83: eq_big_mul_div(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   85:     test(TestFile).
   86: 
   87: %% Tests border cases between small/big.
   88: borders(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   89:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   90:     test(TestFile).
   91: 
   92: negative(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   93:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   94:     test(TestFile).
   95: 
   96: karatsuba(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   97:     TestFile = test_file(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
   98:     test(TestFile).
   99: 
  100: 
  101: %% Find test file
  102: test_file(Config, Name) ->
  103:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  104:     filename:join(DataDir, Name) ++ ".dat".
  105: 
  106: %%
  107: %%
  108: %% Run test on file test_big_seq.erl
  109: %%
  110: %%
  111: test(File) ->
  112:     test(File, [node()]).
  113: 
  114: test(File, Nodes) ->
  115:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  116:     Res = test(File, Fd, Nodes),
  117:     file:close(Fd),
  118:     case Res of
  119: 	{0,Cases} -> {comment, integer_to_list(Cases) ++ " cases"};
  120: 	{_,_} -> ct:fail("failed")
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: test(File, Fd, Ns) ->
  124:     test(File, Fd, Ns, 0, 0, 0).
  125: 
  126: test(File, Fd, Ns, L, Cases, Err) ->
  127:     case io:parse_erl_exprs(Fd, '') of
  128: 	{eof,_} -> {Err, Cases};
  129: 	{error, {Line,_Mod,Message}, _} ->
  130: 	    Fmt = erl_parse:format_error(Message),
  131: 	    io:format("~s:~w: error ~s~n", [File, Line+L, Fmt]),
  132: 	    {Err+1, Cases};
  133: 	{ok, [{match,ThisLine,Expr1,Expr2}], Line} ->
  134: 	    case multi_match(Ns, {op,0,'-',Expr1,Expr2}) of
  135: 		[] ->
  136: 		    test(File, Fd, Ns, Line+L-1,Cases+1, Err);
  137: 		[_|_] ->
  138: 		    PP = erl_pp:expr({op,0,'=/=',Expr1,Expr2}),
  139: 		    io:format("~s:~w : error ~s~n", [File,ThisLine+L, PP]),
  140: 		    test(File, Fd, Ns, Line+L-1,Cases+1, Err+1)
  141: 	    end;
  142: 	{ok, Exprs, Line} ->
  143: 	    PP = erl_pp:exprs(Exprs),
  144: 	    io:format("~s: ~w: equation expected not ~s~n", [File,Line+L,PP]),
  145: 	    test(File, Fd, Ns, Line+L-1,Cases+1, Err+1)
  146:     end.
  147: 
  148: multi_match(Ns, Expr) ->
  149:     multi_match(Ns, Expr, []).
  150: 
  151: multi_match([Node|Ns], Expr, Rs) ->
  152:     X = rpc:call(Node, big_SUITE, eval, [Expr]),
  153:     if X == 0 -> multi_match(Ns, Expr, Rs);
  154:        true -> multi_match(Ns, Expr, [{Node,X}|Rs])
  155:     end;
  156: multi_match([], _, Rs) -> Rs.
  157: 
  158: eval(Expr) ->
  159:     LFH = fun(Name, As) -> apply(?MODULE, Name, As) end,
  160: 
  161:     %% Applied arithmetic BIFs.
  162:     {value,V,_} = erl_eval:expr(Expr, [], {value,LFH}),
  163: 
  164:     %% Real arithmetic instructions.
  165:     V = eval(Expr, LFH),
  166: 
  167:     V.
  168: 
  169: %% Like a subset of erl_eval:expr/3, but uses real arithmetic instructions instead of
  170: %% applying them (it does make a difference).
  171: 
  172: eval({op,_,Op,A0}, LFH) ->
  173:     A = eval(A0, LFH),
  174:     Res = eval_op(Op, A),
  175:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  176:     Res;
  177: eval({op,_,Op,A0,B0}, LFH) ->
  178:     [A,B] = eval_list([A0,B0], LFH),
  179:     Res = eval_op(Op, A, B),
  180:     ok = eval_op_guard(Op, A, B, Res),
  181:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  182:     Res;
  183: eval({integer,_,I}, _) ->
  184:     %% "Parasitic" ("symbiotic"?) test of squaring all numbers
  185:     %% found in the test data.
  186:     test_squaring(I),
  187:     I;
  188: eval({call,_,{atom,_,Local},Args0}, LFH) ->
  189:     Args = eval_list(Args0, LFH),
  190:     LFH(Local, Args).
  191: 
  192: eval_list([E|Es], LFH) ->
  193:     [eval(E, LFH)|eval_list(Es, LFH)];
  194: eval_list([], _) -> [].
  195: 
  196: eval_op('-', A) -> -A;
  197: eval_op('+', A) -> +A;
  198: eval_op('bnot', A) -> bnot A.
  199: 
  200: eval_op('-', A, B) -> A - B;
  201: eval_op('+', A, B) -> A + B;
  202: eval_op('*', A, B) -> A * B;
  203: eval_op('div', A, B) -> A div B;
  204: eval_op('rem', A, B) -> A rem B;
  205: eval_op('band', A, B) -> A band B;
  206: eval_op('bor', A, B) -> A bor B;
  207: eval_op('bxor', A, B) -> A bxor B;
  208: eval_op('bsl', A, B) -> A bsl B;
  209: eval_op('bsr', A, B) -> A bsr B.
  210: 
  211: eval_op_guard('-', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A - B -> ok;
  212: eval_op_guard('+', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A + B -> ok;
  213: eval_op_guard('*', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A * B -> ok;
  214: eval_op_guard('div', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A div B -> ok;
  215: eval_op_guard('rem', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A rem B -> ok;
  216: eval_op_guard('band', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A band B -> ok;
  217: eval_op_guard('bor', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A bor B -> ok;
  218: eval_op_guard('bxor', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A bxor B -> ok;
  219: eval_op_guard('bsl', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A bsl B -> ok;
  220: eval_op_guard('bsr', A, B, Res) when Res =:= A bsr B -> ok;
  221: eval_op_guard(Op, A, B, Res) -> {error,{Op,A,B,Res}}.
  222: 
  223: test_squaring(I) ->
  224:     %% Multiplying an integer by itself is specially optimized, so we
  225:     %% should take special care to test squaring.  The optimization
  226:     %% will kick in when the two operands have the same address.
  227:     Sqr = I * I,
  228: 
  229:     %% This expression will be multiplied in the usual way, because
  230:     %% the two operands for '*' are stored at different addresses.
  231:     Sqr = I * ((I + id(1)) - id(1)),
  232: 
  233:     ok.
  234: 
  235: %% Built in test functions
  236: 
  237: fac(0) -> 1;
  238: fac(1) -> 1;
  239: fac(N) -> N * fac(N-1).
  240: 
  241: %%
  242: %% X ^ N
  243: %%
  244: pow(_, 0) -> 1;
  245: pow(X, 1) -> X;
  246: pow(X, N) when (N band 1) == 1 ->
  247:     X2 = pow(X, N bsr 1),
  248:     X*X2*X2;
  249: pow(X, N) ->
  250:     X2 = pow(X, N bsr 1),
  251:     X2*X2.
  252: 
  253: fib(0) -> 1;
  254: fib(1) -> 1;
  255: fib(N) -> fib(N-1) + fib(N-2).
  256: 
  257: %%
  258: %% Gcd 
  259: %%
  260: gcd(Q, 0) -> Q;
  261: gcd(Q, R) -> gcd(R, Q rem R).
  262: 
  263: %%
  264: %% Least common multiple
  265: %%
  266: lcm(Q, R) ->
  267:     Q*R div gcd(Q, R).
  268: 
  269: 
  270: %% Test case t_div cut in from R2D test suite.
  271: 
  272: t_div(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  273:     'try'(fun() -> 98765432101234 div 98765432101235 end, 0),
  274: 
  275:     % Big remainder, small quotient.
  276:     'try'(fun() -> 339254531512 div 68719476736 end, 4),
  277:     ok.
  278: 
  279: 'try'(Fun, Result) ->
  280:     'try'(89, Fun, Result, []).
  281: 
  282: 'try'(0, _, _, _) ->
  283:     ok;
  284: 'try'(Iter, Fun, Result, Filler) ->
  285:     spawn(?MODULE, init, [self(), Fun, list_to_tuple(Filler)]),
  286:     receive
  287: 	{result, Result} ->
  288: 	    'try'(Iter-1, Fun, Result, [0|Filler]);
  289: 	{result, Other} ->
  290: 	    ct:fail("Expected ~p; got ~p~n", [Result, Other])
  291:     end.
  292: 
  293: init(ReplyTo, Fun, _Filler) ->
  294:     ReplyTo ! {result, Fun()}.
  295: 
  296: %% Tests that big-number literals work correctly.
  297: big_literals(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  298:     %% Note: The literal test cannot be compiler on a pre-R4 Beam emulator,
  299:     %% so we compile it now.
  300:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  301:     Test = filename:join(DataDir, "literal_test"),
  302:     {ok, Mod, Bin} = compile:file(Test, [binary]),
  303:     {module, Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Bin),
  304:     ok = Mod:t(),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: 
  308: %% OTP-2436, part 1
  309: big_float_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     %% F is a number very close to a maximum float.
  311:     F = id(1.7e308),
  312:     I = trunc(F),
  313:     true = (I == F),
  314:     false = (I /= F),
  315:     true = (I > F/2),
  316:     false = (I =< F/2),
  317:     true = (I*2 >= F),
  318:     false = (I*2 < F),
  319:     true = (I*I > F),
  320:     false = (I*I =< F),
  321: 
  322:     true = (F == I),
  323:     false = (F /= I),
  324:     false = (F/2 > I),
  325:     true = (F/2 =< I),
  326:     false = (F >= I*2),
  327:     true = (F < I*2),
  328:     false = (F > I*I),
  329:     true = (F =< I*I),
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: %% "OTP-2436, part 2
  333: big_float_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     F = id(1.7e308),
  335:     I = trunc(F),
  336:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch 1/(2*I)),
  337:     _Ignore = 2/I,
  338:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch 4/(2*I)),
  339:     ok.
  340: 
  341: %% OTP-3256
  342: shift_limit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     case catch (id(1) bsl 100000000) of
  344: 	      {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} ->
  345: 		  ok
  346: 	  end,
  347:     ok.
  348: 
  349: powmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  350:     A = 1696192905348584855517250509684275447603964214606878827319923580493120589769459602596313014087329389174229999430092223701630077631205171572331191216670754029016160388576759960413039261647653627052707047,
  351:     B = 43581177444506616087519351724629421082877485633442736512567383077022781906420535744195118099822189576169114064491200598595995538299156626345938812352676950427869649947439032133573270227067833308153431095,
  352:     C = 52751775381034251994634567029696659541685100826881826508158083211003576763074162948462801435204697796532659535818017760528684167216110865807581759669824808936751316879636014972704885388116861127856231,
  353:     42092892863788727404752752803608028634538446791189806757622214958680350350975318060071308251566643822307995215323107194784213893808887471095918905937046217646432382915847269148913963434734284563536888 = powmod(A, B, C),
  354:     ok.
  355: 
  356: powmod(A, 1, C) ->
  357:     A rem C;
  358: powmod(A, 2, C) ->
  359:     A*A rem C;
  360: powmod(A, B, C) ->
  361:     B1 = B div 2,
  362:     B2 = B - B1,
  363:     P = powmod(A, B1, C),
  364:     case B2 of
  365: 	B1 ->
  366: 	    (P*P) rem C;
  367: 	_  -> 
  368: 	    (P*P*A) rem C
  369:     end.
  370: 
  371: system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  372:     Maxbig = maxbig(),
  373:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch Maxbig+1),
  374:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch -Maxbig-1),
  375:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch 2*Maxbig),
  376:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch bnot Maxbig),
  377:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch apply(erlang, id('bnot'), [Maxbig])),
  378:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch Maxbig bsl 2),
  379:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch apply(erlang, id('bsl'), [Maxbig,2])),
  380:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch id(1) bsl (1 bsl 45)),
  381:     {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch id(1) bsl (1 bsl 69)),
  382: 
  383:     %% There should be no system_limit exception when shifting a zero.
  384:     0 = id(0) bsl (1 bsl 128),
  385:     0 = id(0) bsr -(1 bsl 128),
  386:     Erlang = id(erlang),
  387:     0 = Erlang:'bsl'(id(0), 1 bsl 128),
  388:     0 = Erlang:'bsr'(id(0), -(1 bsl 128)),
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: maxbig() ->
  392:     erlang:system_info(max_integer).
  393: 
  394: toobig(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  395:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} = (catch toobig()),
  396:     ok.
  397: 
  398: toobig() ->
  399:     A = erlang:term_to_binary(lists:seq(1000000, 2200000)),
  400:     ASize = erlang:bit_size(A),
  401:     <<ANr:ASize>> = A, % should fail
  402:     ANr band ANr.
  403: 
  404: %% Tests for DIV/REM bug reported in OTP-6692
  405: otp_6692(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  406:     loop1(1,1000).
  407: 
  408: fact(N) ->
  409:      fact(N,1).
  410: 
  411: fact(0,P) -> P;
  412: fact(N,P) -> fact(N-1,P*N).
  413: 
  414: raised(X,1) ->
  415:     X;
  416: raised(X,N) ->
  417:     X*raised(X,N-1).
  418: 
  419: loop1(M,M) ->
  420:     ok;
  421: loop1(N,M) ->
  422:     loop2(fact(N),raised(7,7),1,8),
  423:     loop1(N+1,M).
  424: 
  425: loop2(_,_,M,M) ->
  426:     ok;
  427: loop2(X,Y,N,M) ->
  428:     Z = raised(Y,N),
  429:     case X rem Z of
  430: 	Z ->
  431: 	    exit({failed,X,'REM',Z,'=',Z});
  432: 	0 ->
  433: 	    case (X div Z) * Z of
  434: 		X ->
  435: 		    ok;
  436: 		Wrong ->
  437: 		    exit({failed,X,'DIV',Z,'*',Z,'=',Wrong})
  438: 	    end;
  439: 	_ ->
  440: 	    ok
  441:     end,
  442:     loop2(X,Y,N+1,M).
  443:     
  444: 
  445: %% ERL-450
  446: bxor_2pow(_Config) ->
  447:     IL = lists:seq(8*3, 8*16, 4),
  448:     JL = lists:seq(0, 64),
  449:     [bxor_2pow_1((1 bsl I), (1 bsl J))
  450:      || I <- IL, J <- JL],
  451:     ok.
  452: 
  453: bxor_2pow_1(A, B) ->
  454:     for(-1,1, fun(Ad) ->
  455:                       for(-1,1, fun(Bd) ->
  456:                                         bxor_2pow_2(A+Ad, B+Bd),
  457:                                         bxor_2pow_2(-A+Ad, B+Bd),
  458:                                         bxor_2pow_2(A+Ad, -B+Bd),
  459:                                         bxor_2pow_2(-A+Ad, -B+Bd)
  460:                                 end)
  461:               end).
  462: 
  463: for(From, To, _Fun) when From > To ->
  464:     ok;
  465: for(From, To, Fun) ->
  466:     Fun(From),
  467:     for(From+1, To, Fun).
  468: 
  469: bxor_2pow_2(A, B) ->
  470:     Correct = my_bxor(A, B),
  471:     case A bxor B of
  472:         Correct -> ok;
  473:         Wrong ->
  474:             io:format("~.16b bxor ~.16b\n", [A,B]),
  475:             io:format("Expected ~.16b\n", [Correct]),
  476:             io:format("Got      ~.16b\n", [Wrong]),
  477:             ct:fail({failed, 'bxor'})
  478: 
  479:     end.
  480: 
  481: %% Implement bxor without bxor
  482: my_bxor(A, B) ->
  483:     my_bxor(A, B, 0, 0).
  484: 
  485: my_bxor(0, 0, _, Acc) -> Acc;
  486: my_bxor(-1, -1, _, Acc) -> Acc;
  487: my_bxor(-1, 0, N, Acc) -> (-1 bsl N) bor Acc; % sign extension
  488: my_bxor(0, -1, N, Acc) -> (-1 bsl N) bor Acc; % sign extension
  489: my_bxor(A, B, N, Acc0) ->
  490:     Acc1 = case (A band 1) =:= (B band 1) of
  491:                true -> Acc0;
  492:                false -> Acc0 bor (1 bsl N)
  493:           end,
  494:     my_bxor(A bsr 1, B bsr 1, N+1, Acc1).
  495: 
  496: 
  497: %% ERL-804
  498: band_2pow(_Config) ->
  499:     IL = lists:seq(8*3, 8*16, 4),
  500:     JL = lists:seq(0, 64),
  501:     [band_2pow_1((1 bsl I), (1 bsl J))
  502:      || I <- IL, J <- JL],
  503:     ok.
  504: 
  505: band_2pow_1(A, B) ->
  506:     for(-1,1, fun(Ad) ->
  507:                       for(-1,1, fun(Bd) ->
  508:                                         band_2pow_2(A+Ad, B+Bd),
  509:                                         band_2pow_2(-A+Ad, B+Bd),
  510:                                         band_2pow_2(A+Ad, -B+Bd),
  511:                                         band_2pow_2(-A+Ad, -B+Bd)
  512:                                 end)
  513:               end).
  514: 
  515: band_2pow_2(A, B) ->
  516:     Correct = my_band(A, B),
  517:     case A band B of
  518:         Correct -> ok;
  519:         Wrong ->
  520:             io:format("~.16# band ~.16#\n", [A,B]),
  521:             io:format("Expected ~.16#\n", [Correct]),
  522:             io:format("Got      ~.16#\n", [Wrong]),
  523:             ct:fail({failed, 'band'})
  524: 
  525:     end.
  526: 
  527: %% Implement band without band
  528: my_band(A, B) ->
  529:     bnot ((bnot A) bor (bnot B)).
  530: 
  531: properties(_Config) ->
  532:     rand_seed(),
  533:     _ = [begin
  534:              A = id(rand_int()),
  535:              B = id(rand_int()),
  536:              C = id(rand_int()),
  537:              io:format("~.36#\n~.36#\n~.36#\n", [A,B,C]),
  538:              test_properties(A, B, C)
  539:          end || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1000)],
  540:     ok.
  541: 
  542: test_properties(A, B, C) ->
  543:     SquaredA = id(A * A),
  544:     SquaredB = id(B * B),
  545: 
  546:     P = id(A * B),
  547:     P = id(B * A),
  548:     A = id(P div B),
  549:     B = id(P div A),
  550:     A = SquaredA div A,
  551:     B = SquaredB div B,
  552:     0 = P rem A,
  553:     0 = P rem B,
  554: 
  555:     Sum = id(A + B),
  556:     Sum = id(B + A),
  557:     A = id(Sum - B),
  558:     B = id(Sum - A),
  559:     0 = Sum - A - B,
  560:     C = id(A + B + C) - Sum,
  561: 
  562:     PS = id(A * B + C),
  563:     PS = P + C,
  564:     ok = test_mul_add_guard(A, B, C, PS),
  565: 
  566:     NegA = id(-A),
  567:     A = -NegA,
  568:     NegB = id(-B),
  569:     B = -NegB,
  570: 
  571:     Diff = id(A - B),
  572:     Diff = -id(B - A),
  573:     Diff = id(A + NegB),
  574:     Diff = -id(NegA + B),
  575: 
  576:     SquaredSum = id(Sum * Sum),
  577:     SquaredSum = Sum * id(A + B),
  578:     SquaredSum = SquaredA + SquaredB + 2*P,
  579: 
  580:     SumTimesDiff = id(Sum * Diff),
  581:     SumTimesDiff = SquaredA - SquaredB,
  582: 
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: test_mul_add_guard(A, B, C, Res) when Res =:= A * B + C -> ok.
  586: 
  587: rand_int() ->
  588:     Sz = max(floor(rand:normal() * 512 + 256), 7),
  589:     <<Int:Sz/signed-unit:8>> = rand:bytes(Sz),
  590:     Int.
  591: 
  592: %%%
  593: %%% Common utilities.
  594: %%%
  595: 
  596: rand_seed() ->
  597:     rand:seed(default),
  598:     io:format("\n*** rand:export_seed() = ~w\n\n", [rand:export_seed()]),
  599:     ok.
  600: 
  601: id(I) -> I.
